comment.author: 37718677955@N01
comment._content: perhaps this archive item needs a date adjustment?

comment.author: 32045990@N07
comment._content:
The handwritten date is the date the postcard was written. We use the ca. 1915 as a best guess as to when the card was produced.

And for a bit more on museums and numbers: the pencilled three part # on the bottom left is our accession number. It shows that we acquired this object in 1977, that it was 67th lot brought in that year, and of the lot, it was the 38th item.

comment.author: 17928778@N00
comment._content: In my opinion, this postcard is not earlier than 1917. Red Cross postcards where available through the Red Cross Home Service, which was created in 1917, with the arrival of American soldiers in France. (see www.redcross.org/museum/history/ww1a.asp )
